channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024010713
item.description:
Report X-2024010713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was presented to the INDH spill office. While investigating the shipment the agent found four plastic jugs inside package inside of a plastic bag. The caps on all four jugs were loose and spilled contents inside of the fiberboard box. The caps were tightened and then they were all placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024020149
item.description:
Report X-2024020149

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALLOUT FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE AT DA EAST. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE SITE WITH PPE DECISION TREE. INSPECTED THE HAZMAT DIAMOND LABELING; MARKED AS CORROSIVE 8. PH TEST RESULT 6-7. FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE RESPONSE AND DELIVERED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024010819
item.description:
Report X-2024010819

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered and placed in a spill tote, but the person who found it failed to immediately notify qualified personnel and package was left for about an hour before it was discovered by QA. Package was then immediately moved to a hazmat tote and liner and taken to be processed. Package had been promptly put into a spill liner so there was no mess to clean up in the surroundings. DescribePack: Caps were loose and spun freely when interacted with. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in spill liner/tote

item.title: Report X-2024010737
item.description:
Report X-2024010737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET, DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS DEEMED AS 4 X 1LITER PLASTIC BOTTLES OF VIDEOJET CLEANING SOLUTION. ENTIRE PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO LOSE BOTTLE CAPS, CAUSING AN INTERNAL LEAKAGE LEAVING GOODS DAMAGED AND UNUSABLE. DescribePack: FAILED DUE TO LOOSE BOTTLE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.
